books.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla

chapters.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:1
verses.text: Acts of Paul and Thecla:  As Paul was going up to Iconium after the flight from Antioch, his fellow-travellers were Demas and Ermogenes, full of hypocrisy; and they were importunate with Paul, as if they loved him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:2
verses.text: But Paul, looking only to the goodness of Christ, did them no harm, but loved them exceedingly, so that he made the oracles of the Lord sweet to them in the teaching both of the birth and the resurrection of the Beloved; and he gave them an account, word for word, of the great things of Christ, how He had been revealed to him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:3
verses.text: And a certain man, by name Onesiphorus, hearing that Paul had come to Iconium, went out to meet him with his children Silas and Zeno, and his wife Lectra, in order that he might entertain him:  for Titus had informed him what Paul was like in appearance:  for he had not seen him in the flesh, but only in the spirit.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:4
verses.text: And he went along the road to Lystra, and stood waiting for him, and kept looking at the passers by according to the description of Titus.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:5
verses.text: And he saw Paul coming, a man small in size, bald-headed, bandy-legged, well-built, with eyebrows meeting, rather long-nosed, full of grace.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:6
verses.text: For sometimes he seemed like a man, and sometimes he had the countenance of an angel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:7
verses.text: And Paul, seeing Onesiphorus, smiled; and Onesiphorus said:  Hail, O servant of the blessed God!  And he said:  Grace be with thee and thy house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:8
verses.text: And Demas and Ermogenes were jealous, and showed greater hypocrisy; so that Demas said:  Are not we of the blessed God, that thou hast not thus saluted us?  And Onesiphorus said:  I do not see in you the fruit of righteousness; but if such you be, come you also into my house and rest yourselves.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:9
verses.text: And Paul having gone into the house of Onesiphorus, there was great joy, and bending of knees, and breaking of bread, and the word of God about self-control and the resurrection; Paul saying:  Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God:  blessed are they that have kept the flesh chaste, for they shall become a temple of God:  blessed are they that control themselves, for God shall speak with them:  blessed are they that have kept aloof from this world, for they shall be called upright:  blessed are they that have wives as not having them, for they shall receive God for their portion:  blessed are they that have the fear of God, for they shall become angels of God:  blessed are they that have kept the baptism, for they shall rest beside the Father and the Son:  blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy, and shall not see the bitter day of judgment:  blessed are the bodies of the virgins, for they shall be well pleasing to God, and shall not lose the reward of their chastity; for the word of the Father shall become to them a work of salvation against the day of His Son, and they shall have rest for ever and ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:10
verses.text: And while Paul was thus speaking in the midst of the church in the house of Onesiphorus, a certain virgin Thecla, the daughter of Theocleia, betrothed to a man named Thamyris, sitting at the window close by, listened night and day to the discourse of virginity and prayer, and did not look away from the window, but paid earnest heed to the faith, rejoicing exceedingly.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:11
verses.text: And when she still saw many women going in beside Paul, she also had an eager desire to be deemed worthy to stand in the presence of Paul, and to hear the word of Christ; for never had she seen his figure, but heard his word only.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:12
verses.text: And as she did not stand away from the window, her mother sends to Thamyris; and he comes gladly, as if already receiving her in marriage.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:13
verses.text: And Theocleia said:  I have a strange story to tell thee, Thamyris; for assuredly for three days and three nights Thecla does not rise from the window, neither to eat nor to drink; but looking earnestly as if upon some pleasant sight, she is so devoted to a foreigner teaching deceitful and artful discourses, that I wonder how a virgin of such modesty is so painfully put about.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:14
verses.text: Thamyris, this man will overturn the city of the Iconians, and thy Thecla too besides; for all the women and the young men go in beside him, being taught to fear God and to live in chastity.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:15
verses.text: Moreover also my daughter, tied to the window like a spider, lays hold of what is said by Paul with a strange eagerness and awful emotion; for the virgin looks eagerly at what is said by him, and has been captivated.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:16
verses.text: But do thou go near and speak to her, for she has been betrothed to thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:17
verses.text: And Thamyris going near, and kissing her, but at the same time also being afraid of her overpowering emotion, said:  Thecla, my betrothed, why dost thou sit thus? and what sort of feeling holds thee overpowered?  Turn round to thy Thamyris, and be ashamed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:18
verses.text: Moreover also her mother said the same things:  Why dost thou sit thus looking down, my child, and answering nothing, but like a mad woman?  And they wept fearfully, Thamyris indeed for the loss of a wife, and Theocleia of a child, and the maidservants of a mistress:  there was accordingly much confusion in the house of mourning.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:19
verses.text: And while these things were thus going on, Thecla did not turn round, but kept attending earnestly to the word of Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:20
verses.text: And Thamyris starting up, went forth into the street, and kept watching those going in to him and coming out.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:21
verses.text: And he saw two men bitterly contending with each other; and he said:  Men, tell me who this is among you, leading astray the souls of young men, and deceiving virgins, so that they do not marry, but remain as they are.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:22
verses.text: I promise, therefore, to give you money enough if you tell me about him; for I am the first man of the city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:23
verses.text: And Demas and Ermogenes said to him:  Who this is, indeed, we do not know; but he deprives young men of wives, and maidens of husbands, saying, There is for you a resurrection in no other way, unless you remain chaste, and pollute not the flesh, but keep it chaste.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:24
verses.text: And Thamyris said to them:  Come into my house, and rest yourselves.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:25
verses.text: And they went to a sumptuous dinner, and much wine, and great wealth, and a splendid table; and Thamyris made them drink, from his love to Thecla, and his wish to get her as his wife.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:26
verses.text: And Thamyris said during the dinner:  Ye men, what is his teaching, tell me, that I also may know; for I am no little distressed about Thecla, because she thus loves the stranger, and I am prevented from marrying.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:27
verses.text: Demas and Ermogenes said:  Bring him before the governor Castelios on the charge of persuading the multitudes to embrace the new teaching of the Christians, and he will speedily destroy him, and thou shalt have Thecla as thy wife.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:28
verses.text: And we shall teach thee that the resurrection of which this man speaks has taken place, because it has already taken place in the children which we have; and we rose again when we came to the knowledge of the true God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:29
verses.text: And Thamyris, hearing these things, being filled with anger and rage, rising up early, went to the house of Onesiphorus with archons and public officers, and a great crowd with batons, saying:  Thou hast corrupted the city of the Iconians, and her that was betrothed to me, so that she will not have me:  let us go to the governor Castelios.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:30
verses.text: And all the multitude said:  Away with the magician; for he has corrupted all our wives, and the multitudes have been persuaded to change their opinions.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:31
verses.text: And Thamyris, standing before the tribunal, said with a great shout:  O proconsul, this man, who he is we know not, who makes virgins averse to marriage; let him say before thee on what account he teaches these things.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:32
verses.text: And Demas and Ermogenes said to Thamyris:  Say that he is a Christian, and thus thou wilt do away with him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:33
verses.text: But the proconsul stayed his intention, and called Paul, saying:  Who art thou, and what dost thou teach? for they bring no small charges against thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:34
verses.text: And Paul lifted up his voice, saying:  Since I am this day examined as to what I teach, listen, O proconsul:  A living God, a God of retributions, a jealous God, a God in need of nothing, consulting for the salvation of men, has sent me that I may reclaim them from corruption and uncleanness, and from all pleasure, and from death, that they may not sin.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:35
verses.text: Wherefore God sent His own Son, whom I preach, and in whom I teach men to rest their hope, who alone has had compassion upon a world led astray, that they may be no longer under judgment, O proconsul, but may have faith, and the fear of God, and the knowledge of holiness, and the love of truth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:36
verses.text: If, therefore, I teach what has been revealed to me by God, wherein do I do wrong?  And the proconsul having heard, ordered Paul to be bound, and sent to prison, until, said he, I, being at leisure, shall hear him more attentively.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:37
verses.text: And Thecla by night having taken off her bracelets, gave them to the gatekeeper; and the door having been opened to her, she went into the prison; and having given the jailor a silver mirror, she went in beside Paul, and, sitting at his feet, she heard the great things of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:38
verses.text: And Paul was afraid of nothing, but ordered his life in the confidence of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:39
verses.text: And her faith also was increased, and she kissed his bonds.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:40
verses.text: And when Thecla was sought for by her friends, and Thamyris, as if she had been lost, was running up and down the streets, one of the gatekeeper's fellow-slaves informed him that she had gone out by night.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:41
verses.text: And having gone out, they examined the gatekeeper; and he said to them:  She has gone to the foreigner into the prison.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:42
verses.text: And having gone, they found her, as it were, enchained by affection.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:43
verses.text: And having gone forth thence, they drew the multitudes together, and informed the governor of the circumstance.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:44
verses.text: And he ordered Paul to be brought to the tribunal; but Thecla was wallowing on the ground in the place where he sat and taught her in the prison; and he ordered her too to be brought to the tribunal.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:45
verses.text: And she came, exulting with joy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:46
verses.text: And the crowd, when Paul had been brought, vehemently cried out:  He is a magician! away with him!  But the proconsul gladly heard Paul upon the holy works of Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:47
verses.text: And having called a council, he summoned Thecla, and said to her:  Why dost thou not obey Thamyris, according to the law of the Iconians?  But she stood looking earnestly at Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:48
verses.text: And when she gave no answer, her mother cried out, saying:  Burn the wicked wretch; burn in the midst of the theatre her that will not marry, in order that all the women that have been taught by this man may be afraid.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:49
verses.text: And the governor was greatly moved; and having scourged Paul, he cast him out of the city, and condemned Thecla to be burned.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:50
verses.text: And immediately the governor went away to the theatre, and all the crowd went forth to the spectacle of Thecla.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:51
verses.text: But as a lamb in the wilderness looks round for the shepherd, so she kept searching for Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:52
verses.text: And having looked upon the crowd, she saw the Lord sitting in the likeness of Paul, and said:  As I am unable to endure my lot, Paul has come to see me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:53
verses.text: And she gazed upon him with great earnestness, and he went up into heaven.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:54
verses.text: But the maid-servants and virgins brought the faggots, in order that Thecla might be burned.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:55
verses.text: And when she came in naked, the governor wept, and wondered at the power that was in her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:56
verses.text: And the public executioners arranged the faggots for her to go up on the pile.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:57
verses.text: And she, having made the sign of the cross, went up on the faggots; and they lighted them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:58
verses.text: And though a great fire was blazing, it did not touch her; for God, having compassion upon her, made an underground rumbling, and a cloud overshadowed them from above, full of water and hail; and all that was in the cavity of it was poured out, so that many were in danger of death.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:59
verses.text: And the fire was put out, and Thecla saved.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:60
verses.text: And Paul was fasting with Onesiphorus and his wife, and his children, in a new tomb, as they were going from Iconium to Daphne.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:61
verses.text: And when many days were past, the fasting children said to Paul:  We are hungry, and we cannot buy loaves; for Onesiphorus had left the things of the world, and followed Paul, with all his house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:62
verses.text: And Paul, having taken off his cloak, said:  Go, my child, buy more loaves, and bring them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:63
verses.text: And when the child was buying, he saw Thecla their neighbour, and was astonished, and said:  Thecla, whither art thou going?  And she said:  I have been saved from the fire, and am following Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:64
verses.text: And the boy said:  Come, I shall take thee to him; for he is distressed about thee, and is praying six days.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:65
verses.text: And she stood beside the tomb where Paul was with bended knees, and praying, and saying:  O Saviour Christ, let not the fire touch Thecla, but stand by her, for she is Thine.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:66
verses.text: And she, standing behind him, cried out:  O Father, who hast made the heaven and the earth, the Father of Thy holy Son, I bless Thee that Thou hast saved me that I may see Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:67
verses.text: And Paul, rising up, saw her, and said:  O God, that knowest the heart, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, I bless Thee that Thou, having heard me, hast done quickly what I wished.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:68
verses.text: And they had five loaves, and herbs, and water; and they rejoiced in the holy works of Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:69
verses.text: And Thecla said to Paul:  I shall cut my hair, and follow thee whithersoever thou mayst go.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:70
verses.text: And he said:  It is a shameless age, and thou art beautiful.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:71
verses.text: I am afraid lest another temptation come upon thee worse than the first, and that thou withstand it not, but be cowardly.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:72
verses.text: And Thecla said:  Only give me the seal in Christ, and temptation shall not touch me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:73
verses.text: And Paul said:  Thecla, wait with patience, and thou shalt receive the water.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:74
verses.text: And Paul sent away Onesiphorus and all his house to Iconium; and thus, having taken Thecla, he went into Antioch.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:75
verses.text: And as they were going in, a certain Syriarch, Alexander by name, seeing Thecla, became enamoured of her, and tried to gain over Paul by gifts and presents.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:76
verses.text: But Paul said:  I know not the woman whom thou speakest of, nor is she mine.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:77
verses.text: But he, being of great power, himself embraced her in the street.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:78
verses.text: But she would not endure it, but looked about for Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:79
verses.text: And she cried out bitterly, saying:  Do not force the stranger; do not force the servant of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:80
verses.text: I am one of the chief persons of the Iconians; and because I would not have Thamyris, I have been cast out of the city.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:81
verses.text: And taking hold of Alexander, she tore his cloak, and pulled off his crown, and made him a laughing-stock.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:82
verses.text: And he, at the same time loving her, and at the same time ashamed of what had happened, led her before the governor; and when she had confessed that she had done these things, he condemned her to the wild beasts.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:83
verses.text: And the women were struck with astonishment, and cried out beside the tribunal:  Evil judgment! impious judgment!  And she asked the governor, that, said she, I may remain pure until I shall fight with the wild beasts.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:84
verses.text: And a certain Tryphaena, whose daughter was dead, took her into keeping, and had her for a consolation.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:85
verses.text: And when the beasts were exhibited, they bound her to a fierce lioness; and Tryphaena accompanied her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:86
verses.text: But the lioness, with Thecla sitting upon her, licked her feet; and all the multitude was astonished.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:87
verses.text: And the charge on her inscription was:  Sacrilegious.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:88
verses.text: And the women cried out from above:  An impious sentence has been passed in this city!  And after the exhibition, Tryphaena again receives her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:89
verses.text: For her daughter Falconilla had died, and said to her in a dream:  Mother, thou shalt have this stranger Thecla in my place, in order that she may pray concerning me, and that I may be transferred to the place of the just.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:90
verses.text: And when, after the exhibition, Tryphaena received her, at the same time indeed she grieved that she had to fight with the wild beasts on the day following; and at the same time, loving her as much as her daughter Falconilla, she said:  My second child Thecla, come and pray for my child, that she may live for ever; for this I saw in my sleep.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:91
verses.text: And she, nothing hesitating, lifted up her voice, and said:  God most high, grant to this woman according to her wish, that her daughter Falconilla may live for ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:92
verses.text: And when Thecla had thus spoken, Tryphaena lamented, considering so much beauty thrown to the wild beasts.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:93
verses.text: And when it was dawn, Alexander came to take her, for it was he that gave the hunt, saying:  The governor is sitting, and the crowd is in uproar against us.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:94
verses.text: Allow me to take away her that is to fight with the wild beasts.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:95
verses.text: And Tryphaena cried aloud, so that he even fled, saying:  A second mourning for my Falconilla has come upon my house and there is no one to help; neither child, for she is dead, nor kinsman, for I am a widow.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:96
verses.text: God of Thecla, help her!  And immediately the governor sends an order that Thecla should be brought.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:97
verses.text: And Tryphaena, taking her by the hand, said:  My daughter Falconilla, indeed, I took away to the tomb; and thee, Thecla, I am taking to the wild-beast fight.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:98
verses.text: And Thecla wept bitterly, saying:  O Lord, the God in whom I believe, to whom I have fled for refuge, who deliveredst me from the fire, do Thou grant a recompense to Tryphaena, who has had compassion on Thy servant, and because she has kept me pure.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:99
verses.text: Then a tumult arose, and a cry of the people, and the women sitting together, the one saying:  Away with the sacrilegious person! the others saying:  Let the city be raised against this wickedness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:100
verses.text: Take off all of us, O proconsul!  Cruel sight! evil sentence!  And Thecla, having been taken out of the hand of Tryphaena, was stripped, and received a girdle, and was thrown into the arena, and lions and bears and a fierce lioness were let loose upon her; and the lioness having run up to her feet, lay down; and the multitude of the women cried aloud.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:101
verses.text: And a bear ran upon her; but the lioness, meeting the bear, tore her to pieces.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:102
verses.text: And again a lion that had been trained against men, which belonged to Alexander, ran upon her; and she, the lioness, encountering the lion, was killed along with him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:103
verses.text: And the women made great lamentation, since also the lioness, her protector, was dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:104
verses.text: Then they send in many wild beasts, she standing and stretching forth her hands, and praying.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:105
verses.text: And when she had finished her prayer, she turned and saw a ditch full of water, and said:  Now it is time to wash myself.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:106
verses.text: And she threw herself in, saying:  In the name of Jesus Christ I am baptized on my last day.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:107
verses.text: And the women seeing, and the multitude, wept, saying:  Do not throw thyself into the water; so that also the governor shed tears, because the seals were going to devour such beauty.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:108
verses.text: She then threw herself in in the name of Jesus Christ; but the seals having seen the glare of the fire of lightning, floated about dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:109
verses.text: And there was round her, as she was naked, a cloud of fire; so that neither could the wild beasts touch her, nor could she be seen naked.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:110
verses.text: And the women, when other wild beasts were being thrown in, wailed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:111
verses.text: And some threw sweet-smelling herbs, others nard, others cassia, others amomum, so that there was abundance of perfumes.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:112
verses.text: And all the wild beasts that had been thrown in, as if they had been withheld by sleep, did not touch her; so that Alexander said to the governor:  I have bulls exceedingly terrible; let us bind to them her that is to fight with the beasts.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:113
verses.text: And the governor, looking gloomy, turned, and said:  Do what thou wilt.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:114
verses.text: And they bound her by the feet between them, and put red-hot irons under the privy parts of the bulls, so that they, being rendered more furious, might kill her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:115
verses.text: They rushed about, therefore; but the burning flame consumed the ropes, and she was as if she had not been bound.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:116
verses.text: But Tryphaena fainted standing beside the arena, so that the crowd said:  Queen Tryphaena is dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:117
verses.text: And the governor put a stop to the games, and the city was in dismay.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:118
verses.text: And Alexander entreated the governor, saying:  Have mercy both on me and the city, and release this woman.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:119
verses.text: For if Caesar hear of these things, he will speedily destroy the city also along with us, because his kinswoman Queen Tryphaena has died beside the Abaci.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:120
verses.text: And the governor summoned Thecla out of the midst of the wild beasts, and said to her:  Who art thou? and what is there about thee, that not one of the wild beasts touches thee?  And she said:  I indeed am a servant of the living God; and as to what there is about me, I have believed in the Son of God, in whom He is well pleased; wherefore not one of the beasts has touched me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:121
verses.text: For He alone is the end of salvation, and the basis of immortal life; for He is a refuge to the tempest-tossed, a solace to the afflicted, a shelter to the despairing; and, once for all, whoever shall not believe on Him, shall not live for ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:122
verses.text: And the governor having heard this, ordered her garments to be brought, and to be put on.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:123
verses.text: And Thecla said:  He that clothed me naked among the wild beasts, will in the day of judgment clothe thee with salvation.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:124
verses.text: And taking the garments, she put them on.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:125
verses.text: The governor therefore immediately issued an edict, saying:  I release to you the God-fearing Thecla, the servant of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:126
verses.text: And the women shouted aloud, and with one mouth returned thanks to God, saying:  There is one God, the God of Thecla; so that the foundations of the theatre were shaken by their voice.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:127
verses.text: And Tryphaena having received the good news, went to meet the holy Thecla, and said:  Now I believe that the dead are raised:  now I believe that my child lives.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:128
verses.text: Come within, and I shall assign to thee all that is mine.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:129
verses.text: She therefore went in along with her, and rested eight days, having instructed her in the word of God, so that most even of the maid-servants believed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:130
verses.text: And there was great joy in the house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:131
verses.text: And Thecla kept seeking Paul; and it was told her that he was in Myra of Lycia.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:132
verses.text: And taking young men and maidens, she girded herself; and having sewed the tunic so as to make a man's cloak, she came to Myra, and found Paul speaking the word of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:133
verses.text: And Paul was astonished at seeing her, and the crowd with her, thinking that some new trial was coming upon her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:134
verses.text: And when she saw him, she said:  I have received the baptism, Paul; for He that wrought along with thee for the Gospel has wrought in me also for baptism.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:135
verses.text: And Paul, taking her, led her to the house of Hermaeus, and hears everything from her, so that those that heard greatly wondered, and were comforted, and prayed over Tryphaena.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:136
verses.text: And she rose up, and said:  I am going to Iconium.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:137
verses.text: And Paul said:  Go, and teach the word of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:138
verses.text: And Tryphaena sent her much clothing and gold, so that she left to Paul many things for the service of the poor.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:139
verses.text: And she went to Iconium.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:140
verses.text: And she goes into the house of Onesiphorus, and fell upon the pavement where Paul used to sit and teach her, and wept, saying:  God of myself and of this house, where Thou didst make the light to shine upon me, O Christ Jesus, the Son of the living God, my help in the fire, my help among the wild beasts, Thou art glorified for ever,  Amen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:141
verses.text: And she found Thamyris dead, but her mother alive.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:142
verses.text: And having sent for her mother, she said:  Theocleia, my mother, canst thou believe that the Lord liveth in the heavens?  For whether thou desirest wealth, God gives it to thee through me; or thy child, I am standing beside thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:143
verses.text: And having thus testified, she departed to Seleucia, and dwelt in a cave seventy-two years, living upon herbs and water.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:144
verses.text: And she enlightened many by the word of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:145
verses.text: And certain men of the city, being Greeks by religion, and physicians by profession, sent to her insolent young men to destroy her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:146
verses.text: For they said:  She is a virgin, and serves Artemis, and from this she has virtue in healing.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:147
verses.text: And by the providence of God she entered into the rock alive, and went under ground.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:148
verses.text: And she departed to Rome to see Paul, and found that he had fallen asleep.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:149
verses.text: And after staying there no long time, she rested in a glorious sleep; and she is buried about two or three stadia from the tomb of her master Paul.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:150
verses.text: She was cast, then, into the fire when seventeen years old, and among the wild beasts when eighteen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:151
verses.text: And she was an ascetic in the cave, as has been said, seventy-two years, so that all the years of her life were ninety.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:152
verses.text: And having accomplished many cures, she rests in the place of the saints, having fallen asleep on the twenty-fourth of the month of September in Christ Jesus our Lord, to whom be glory and strength for ever and ever,  Amen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:153
verses.text: Instead of the last two sections, the ms.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:154
verses.text: which Dr.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:155
verses.text: Grabe used has the following:—  And a cloud of light guided her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:156
verses.text: And having come into Seleucia, she went forth outside of the city one stadium.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:157
verses.text: And she was afraid of them also, for they worshipped idols.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:158
verses.text: And it guided her to the mountain called Calamon or Rhodeon; and having there found a cave, she went into it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:159
verses.text: And she was there many years, and underwent many and grievous trials by the devil, and bore them nobly, being assisted by Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:160
verses.text: And some of the well-born women, having learned about the virgin Thecla, went to her, and learned the oracles of God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:161
verses.text: And many of them bade adieu to the world, and lived an ascetic life with her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:162
verses.text: And a good report was spread everywhere concerning her, and cures were done by her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:163
verses.text: All the city, therefore, and country round, having known this, brought their sick to the mountain; and before they came near the door they were speedily released from whatever disease they were afflicted by; and the unclean spirits went out shrieking, and all received their own in health, glorifying God, who had given such grace to the virgin Thecla.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:164
verses.text: The physicians, therefore, of the city of the Seleucians were thought nothing of, having lost their trade, and no one any longer had regard to them; and being filled with envy and hatred, they plotted against the servant of Christ, what they should do to her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:165
verses.text: The devil then suggests to them a wicked device; and one day, being assembled, and having taken counsel, they consult with each other, saying:  This virgin is a priestess of the great goddess Artemis; and if she ask anything of her, she hears her as being a virgin, and all the gods love her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:166
verses.text: Come, then, let us take men of disorderly lives, and make them drunk with much wine, and let us give them much gold, and say to them, If you can corrupt and defile her, we shall give you even more money.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:167
verses.text: The physicians therefore said to themselves, that if they should be able to defile her, neither the gods nor Artemis would listen to her in the case of the sick.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:168
verses.text: They therefore did so.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:169
verses.text: And the wicked men, having gone to the mountain, and rushed upon the cave like lions, knocked at the door.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:170
verses.text: And the holy martyr Thecla opened, emboldened by the God in whom she believed; for she knew of their plot beforehand.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:171
verses.text: And she says to them:  What do you want, my children?  And they said:  Is there one here called Thecla?  And she said:  What do you want with her?  They say to her:  We want to sleep with her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:172
verses.text: The blessed Thecla says to them:  I am a humble old woman, but the servant of my Lord Jesus Christ; and even though you want to do something to me out of place, you cannot.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:173
verses.text: They say to her:  It is impossible for us not to do to thee what we want.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:174
verses.text: And having said this, they laid fast hold of her, and wished to insult her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:175
verses.text: And she says to them with mildness:  Wait, my children, that you may see the glory of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:176
verses.text: And being laid hold of by them, she looked up into heaven, and said:  God, terrible and incomparable, and glorious to Thine adversaries, who didst deliver me out of the fire, who didst not give me up to Thamyris, who didst not give me up to Alexander, who didst deliver me from the wild beasts, who didst save me in the abyss, who hast everywhere worked with me, and glorified Thy name in me, now also deliver me from these lawless men, and let me not insult my virginity, which through Thy name I have preserved till now, because I love Thee, and desire Thee, and adore Thee, the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost for ever,  Amen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:177
verses.text: And there came a voice out of the heaven, saying:  Fear not, Thecla, my true servant, for I am with thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:178
verses.text: Look and see where an opening has been made before thee, for there shall be for thee an everlasting house, and there thou shalt obtain shelter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:179
verses.text: And the blessed Thecla regarding it, saw the rock opened as far as to allow a man to enter, and did according to what had been said to her: and nobly fleeing from the lawless ones entered into the rock; and the rock was straightway shut together, so that not even a joining appeared.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:180
verses.text: And they, beholding the extraordinary wonder, became as it were distracted; and they were not able to detain the servant of God, but only caught hold of her veil, and were able to tear off a certain part; and that by the permission of God for the faith of those seeing the venerable place, and for a blessing in the generations afterwards to those that believe in our Lord Jesus Christ out of a pure heart.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:181
verses.text: Thus, then, suffered the first martyr of God, and apostle, and virgin, Thecla, who came from Iconium at eighteen years old; and with the journeying, and the going round, and the retirement in the mountain, she lived other seventy-two years.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:182
verses.text: And when the Lord took her, she was ninety years old.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:183
verses.text: And thus is her consummation.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Acts of Paul and Thecla 1:184
verses.text: And her holy commemoration is on the twenty-fourth of the month of September, to the glory of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, now and ever, and to ages of ages,  Amen.
